page.title: 08Normanton Water Museum
page.content: The Water Museum in the former Normanton Church was officially opened in June 1985. As a church it was originally built in 1764 for the owners of Normanton Hall which was sold and demolished in 1925. after the land was purchased for a reservoir the church was deconsecrated and burials reinterred elsewhere. It was found to be too costly to move the church but Â£30.000 was raised to built a bank around it and a causeway, and raise the floor above the water level. It has now been improved and the present Water Museum show how the provision of drinking water has improved over the centuries. The displays are well done and during the summer it is expected to attract many visitors.
